title: Pre-Game at Jordan-Hare: SJSU (2-2) at Auburn (2-2)
text:

Post to Facebook Pre-Game at Jordan-Hare: SJSU (2-2) at Auburn (2-2) The Montgomery Advertiser will be bring you to-the-minute updates leading up to San Jose State at Auburn today. Join the Conversation Auburn Authority Matthew Stevens , Montgomery Advertiser 2:35 p.m. CDT October 3, 2015 
San Jose State tailback Tyler Ervin running the ball during a 59-13 victory for Auburn. Ervin had 300 yards on 42 carries last week against Fresno State. (Photo: Associated Press) 
AUBURN – The Montgomery Advertiser Auburn Authority Blog will be bring you to-the-minute updates leading up to the San Jose State (2-2) at Auburn (2-2) matchup today (3 p.m., SEC Network). 
All you have to do is keep hitting refresh on this page to get constant updates from our Auburn beat reporter Matthew Stevens (@matthewcstevens). 
With kickoff being over five hours away, here's some story lines that have surrounded this game and were published throughout the week. Al Borges returns to Auburn as San Jose State’s offensive coordinator Auburn coach Gus Malzahn announced Tuesday he's going to start redshirt Sean White for a second straight game at quarterback Saturday against San Jose State. Duane Rankin/Montgomery Advertiser 
2:30 p.m. UPDATE - Auburn announced their starting lineup vs. San Jose State minutes ago. Here are the following notable items: Cassanova McKinzy will start at the BUCK today for the injured Carl Lawson. We detailed this week that this is a change that Muschamp is hoping will ignite an awful pass rush through four games. Senior Kris Frost gets the start at linebacker today with Justin Garrett. Freshman CB Tim Irvin is out today for unknown reasons and will be replaced by Jeremiah Dinson in the starting lineup. Chandler Cox is getting the start today at H-back but it will interesting to see if Auburn uses more 3-wide or big formations against San Jose State's poor rush defense.
